page.title: 11A BREWERY IN BURTON
page.content: Page 1 (of 2) Since 1950 the number of breweries in Burton has been reduced because of amalgamations, and Mr.Neame of Marstons claims that theirs is the only true Bur ton brewery left, and even in Marstons, the major shareholder is Whitbreads, a brewing giant. Marstons employ more than 700 people of whom about 470 are engaged in the production side. They have the capacity to brew more than two million pints a week, the pride of their output being 'Pedigree' bitter, although they make their own lagers, mild beers and other bitters. Their 'Low-C' low calorie beer has been very successful, and is sold by other breweries, just as Marstons sell such well-known products as Guinness and Mackesons stouts. They are proud of being a local firm and do a great deal for the town.
